abstract: Citigroup will pay up to $2 billion for a stake of up to 50 percent in the company that controls Banco de Chile, The Financial Times reported. The deal will give Citi, which intends to fold in its existing business in Chile, roughly 20 percent of the overall Chilean market, about on par with Santander of Spain.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup will pay up to $2 billion for a stake of up to 50 percent in the company that controls Banco de Chile, The Financial Times reported. The deal will give Citi, which intends to fold in its existing business in Chile, roughly 20 percent of the overall Chilean market, about on par with Santander of Spain.

headline.main: Citi Spices Up Chilean Portfolio With $2 Billion Acquisition
